title: AI or not, Will Smith’s crowd video is fresh cringe
description: Fans accused Will Smith of sharing AI-generated videos from his tour, but the situation is more complicated than it seems.

title: Mississippi’s age assurance law puts decentralized social networks to the test
description: Bluesky says it would block access to its service in the state of Mississippi, rather than comply with the new age verification law.

title: US manufacturing investment stumbles as clean tech cancellations pile up
description: Companies canceled $5 billion worth of clean tech manufacturing projects in the U.S. in Q2, mirroring a pullback in the broader manufacturing sector.

title: Threads tests a way to share long-form text on the platform
description: With this new feature, users can attach a block of text to a post instead of creating a thread of several different posts when looking to share more in-depth thoughts and ideas.

title: MathGPT.ai, the ‘cheat-proof’ tutor and teaching assistant, expands to over 50 institutions
description: Schools implementing MathGPT.ai in their classrooms include Penn State University, Tufts University, and Liberty University, among others.

title: No-code website builder Framer reaches $2B valuation
description: Framer, a no-code website builder that claims over half a million monthly active users, has reached a $2 billion valuation after raising a $100 million Series D funding round led by existing investors Meritech and Atomico.

title: Mark Cuban’s war on America’s $5 trillion healthcare machine: ‘They can’t react as quickly’
description: Cuban said drug prices are opaque by design. He launched Cost Plus Drugs in 2022 to pull back the curtain on drug pricing, bring down costs to the average consumer, and disrupt the traditional pharmacy industry.
